title.value: Morphological Parameters and Associated Uncertainties for 8 Million Galaxies in the Hyper Suprime-Cam Wide Survey
title.justification: This is the title provided at the top of the research paper.
title.quote: Morphological Parameters and Associated Uncertainties for 8 Million Galaxies in the Hyper Suprime-Cam Wide Survey

extractions.description: The paper presents the use of the Galaxy Morphology Posterior Estimation Network (GaMPEN) to estimate morphological parameters and associated uncertainties for approximately 8 million galaxies in the Hyper Suprime-Cam (HSC) Wide survey. By applying transfer learning on simulated galaxies and real data, GaMPEN achieves high accuracy in predicting full Bayesian posteriors for galaxy morphological parameters, significantly outperforming traditional light-profile fitting algorithms.

type.justification: The paper involves data collection, empirical analysis, model training, and validation on a large dataset of galaxies.
type.quote: In this paper, we use the Galaxy Morphology Posterior Estimation Network (GaMPEN) to estimate morphological parameters and associated uncertainties for ∼ 8 million galaxies in the Hyper Suprime-Cam (HSC) Wide survey with z ≤ 0.75 and m ≤ 23.

name.justification: The primary focus is on estimating morphological parameters from galaxy images, a task central to the field of Computer Vision.
name.quote: The catalog presented in this paper builds on Simard et al. (2011) by providing an order of magnitude increase in sample size and probing four magnitudes deeper, to a higher redshift threshold.

name.justification: The application domain of the research is to facilitate the understanding of galaxy formation and evolution, which falls under Astrophysics.
name.quote: Quantitative measures of the morphological parameters for large samples of galaxies at different redshifts are of fundamental importance in understanding the physics of galaxy formation and evolution.

name.justification: GaMPEN is fundamentally based on machine learning techniques to perform predictions.
name.quote: Over the last decade, machine learning (ML) has been increasingly used for a wide variety of tasks—from identifying exoplanets to studying black holes.

name.justification: The research involves extensive data analysis to train models and validate results.
name.quote: The paper also demonstrates that ML techniques can be used to study morphology in new surveys, which do not have already-classified large training sets available.

name.justification: The paper centers around the use of Galaxy Morphology Posterior Estimation Network (GaMPEN).
